result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amari L Watson

records.addlTxt: defendant appeared on 10-31-2022, case recalled after scheduled hearing time.

COURT IMPOSES AN ADDITIONAL $1000.00 FOR A TOTAL OF $1500.00 BOND.  DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000.00 TO BE RELEASED:  
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. The Defendant is not to contemplate or plan testimony of the case with the Co-actor. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS. Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols or any Family Court action/order. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

1:40 PM Defendant Amari L Watson not in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Amari L Watson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Klein does not know why Ms. Watson is not appearing.  
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. 
Court grants state's motion.  

CASE RECALLED AT 3:10 PM:  Defendant Amari L Watson in court by phone. and in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Amari L Watson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court quashes capias and reinstates bail.
State moves the court to impose an additional $1000 bond.  
Attorney Klein makes statements.
Court imposes an additional $1000 cash bond for a total of $1500 cash bond.  
November 28, 2022 date remains as previously scheduled.
BODY ONLY; for non appearance.
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10-26-2022 received and filed.

**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-27-2022: Schedule a bail hearing.**

Case called at 9:50 AM
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Jessica A Klein appeared by video for Amari L Watson.  
Defendant Amari L Watson in court.  
Court addresses the non-compliance with WCS.
State requests an increase in cash bail.
Defense requests that the Court admonish the defendant.
Court admonishes the defendant.
Attorney Klein requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance report dated 09-30-2022 received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance report dated 09-16-2022 received and filed, re: new charges

3:04 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigial Kincheloe.  Defendant Amari L Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Amari L Watson. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
